required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SPiRE Maestro Hand Exoskeleton for Rehabilitation Post Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of Using Maestro Hand Exoskeleton in Post-stroke Hand Rehabilitation to Improve Joint Coordination

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The research team will develop a novel training tool to improve finger joint coordination, to address the unmet need in the current rehabilitation, thereby enhancing hand function and contributing to improved independence and quality of life for Veterans with stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: The research team will determine feasibility of training using CA and TA controllers in subacute stroke. Specifically, we will examine if joint coordination improves over a training session. The investigators will compare the extent of improvement for each controller and impairment severity.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All participants will experience all controller conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: change in finger joint torque assistance
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the 1st half to the 2nd half of the 1-hour training session
primary_outcome.description: Change in finger joint torque assistance needed from the 1st half to the 2nd half of the 1-hour training session. Reduction in torque is considered a good outcome. There is no predefined minimum/maximum.

arm_group.description: All participants will receive assistance to move finger joints away from the compensatory coordination (compensation avoidance), toward the desired trajectories (task assistance), both, and none in different days.

intervention.description: Participants will receive assistance to move finger joints away from the compensatory coordination (compensation avoidance), toward the desired trajectories (task assistance), both, and none in different days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult Veterans with a stroke 1-6 months ago
- Ability to move fingers (Chedoke-McMaster Hand Section Stage 2-4)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to follow 2-step commands
- Severe muscle tone prohibiting proper placement of the fingers (Modified Ashworth Scale, MAS=5 out of 5)
- Change in spasticity medication or botulinum toxin injection in the upper limb within 3 months prior to or during enrollment

overall_official.last_name: Na Jin Seo, PhD MS BS
overall_official.affiliation: Ralph H. Johnson VA Medical Center, Charleston, SC

facility.name: Ralph H. Johnson VA Medical Center, Charleston, SC

investigator.last_name: Na Jin Seo, PhD MS BS

patient_data.ipd_description: Due to the small sample size, individual data that are de-identified will be presented in publications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: De-identified individual data that are presented in publications will be available as long as the publications are available.
